Death Penalty Reliability 

<http://www.deathpenaltyinfo.org/article.php?did=412&scid=6>As of March 2005, 119 innocent people have been released from death rows across the country since 1973 (Northwestern University, DP Information Center). Researchers Radelet and Bedau found 23 cases where innocent people were executed since 1900 (In Spite of Innocence, Northeastern University Press, 1992). <http://www.mvfr.org/DeathPenaltyFacts.htm>Murder Victims' Families for Reconciliation, Inc.

Carried Out Disportionately 

<http://www.thurgoodmarshall.com/speeches/masks_article.htm>Thurgood Marshall said it was racist, unfair to poor and the mentally retarded, and often ends in the state sanctioned murder of innocents. 
    * Less than 1% of all murderers are condemned to death 
    * 2% of death row inmates are actually executed 
    * Over 113 people on death row have been exonerated since 1973 
    * 68% of the death penalty convictions between 1973 - 1995 were reversed 
    * Today more than 75 death row inmates have spent 20 years on the Row. 
    * Capital punishment is applied to a higher percentage of minorities than whites. 

[PDF] <http://www.karisable.com/url?sa=U&start=10&q=http://lsr.nellco.org/cgi/viewcontent.cgi%3Farticle%3D1062%26context%3Dupenn/wps&e=10053>The Role of Deterrence in the Formulation of Criminal Law

It is not cost effective:

Capital murder trials threaten to bankrupt townships costing taxpayers: 
    * $2 million in legal fees to try a death penalty case, nearly 4 times higher than comparable murder trials. 
    * The automatic appeal process costs up to $700,000 in legal fees. 
    * $1.2 million in execution costs. 
    * 1973 -1998, Florida spent $57 million on 18 executions. 

It is does not deter crime: 

The two states with the most executions in 2003, Texas 24, and Oklahoma 14, saw increases in their murder rates from 2002 to 2003.  Both states had murder rates above the national average in 2003:  Texas - 6.4, and Oklahoma - 5.9.  The top 13 states in terms of murder rates were all death penalty states. The murder rate of the death penalty states increased from 2002, while the rate in non-death penalty states decreased.<http://www.deathpenaltyinfo.org/>Death Penalty Information Center

The Death Penalty has been abolished in all other Western Countries and civilized societies, except the US:

The European Union (EU) is <http://europa.eu.int/comm/external_relations/human_rights/adp/index.htm>opposed to the death penalty in all cases and is "deeply concerned about the increasing number of executions in the United States of America (USA), all the more since the great majority of executions since reinstatement of the death penalty in 1976 have been carried out in the 1990s. Furthermore, in the US, young offenders who are under 18 years of age at the time of the commission of the crime may be sentenced to death and executed, in clear infringement of internationally recognized human rights norms."  Even <http://press.coe.int/cp/97/640a%2897%29.htm>Russia and Turkey have abolished the death penalty which is condemned by the European Union and the World Court, which claimed that the <http://www.thenewamerican.com/artman/publish/article_1018.shtml>U.S. violated the rights of 51 Mexicans on death rows in eight states. 

<http://www.psychiatrictimes.com/showArticle.jhtml?articleId=164303063>Supreme Court Bans Juvenile Death Penalty 

<http://www.pollingreport.com/crime.htm>Opinion Polls on the Death Penalty 
GALLUP POLL: <http://www.deathpenaltyinfo.org/article.php?scid=23&did=1029>Public Divided Between Death Penalty and Life Imprisonment Without Parole June 2004 

<http://www.capitaldefenseweekly.com/index.html>Capital Defense Weekly 

<http://www.lawschool.cornell.edu/lawlibrary/death/>The Cornell Law School's Death Penalty Project 

<http://www.probono.net/areas/about.cfm?Area_ID=7>Assists volunteer lawyers representing death row prisoners -- American Bar Association Death Penalty Representation Project through the generosity of <http://www.soros.org/initiatives/justice/events/deathpenalty_20020718/osi_death_penalty>The Open Society Institute and the law firm of Shearman & Sterling. 

<http://www.capdefnet.org/fdprc/fdprc_web_contents3.htm>Federal Death Penalty Resource Council -- To help defense counsel become familiar with the issues, procedures, and practices of capital prosecutions.

<http://www.soundportraits.org/on-air/execution_tapes/>The Execution Tapes -- Public radio special hosted by Ray Suarez featuring excerpts of recordings made in Georgia's death house during electrocution executions. Since this country's last public execution in 1936, executions have been solely in front of state selected witnesses. The media has tried to bring in cameras and tape recorders, but the courts have consistently ruled, the media has no right to record the scene.

<http://crimemagazine.com/deathrow.htm>Execution Photos -- When the Florida Supreme Court ruled that the electric chair was a constitutional form of execution, an outraged justice of the court attached 3 photographs to his dissent. 

<http://www.deathpenaltyinfo.org/botched.html>Botched lethal injection executions in the USA



MySpace:  http://www.myspace.com/DJApollo 

Tribenet:   <http://people.tribe.net/djapollo2k>http://people.tribe.net/djapollo2k 

Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.org
                
House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

"Look at every path closely and deliberately.  Try it as many times as you think necessary.  Then ask yourself and yourself alone one question.  This question is one that only a very old man asks.  My benefactor told me about it once when I was young and my blood was too vigorous for me to understand it.  Now I do understand it.  I will tell you what it is:  'Does this path have a heart?' If it does the path is good.  If it doesn't, it is of no use."
-Don Juan

"A nation of sheep will beget a government of wolves."
-Edward R. Murrow

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

Subject: Re: [sfraves] dj jen lasher: no more tears

I'm sorry, I just think this is funny. like it might be embarrassing,
and certainly I can understand people being upset about it, and yes,
ex-boyfriends are sometimes vicious bastards, but you live life like a
rock star, and then you're angry because you have an audience? come
on, get over yourselves. any one of us could have been born a peasant
in China or a slave in Kuwait. have some perspective. it isn't such a
big soap opera. a party girl partied. that isn't even news.

there was a DJ here in SF. the Bush Administration initiated
deportation proceedings against him because he was Pakistani. he's
gay. in Pakistan, homosexuality is a crime punishable by death. THAT
is sad. he came here to escape being killed by a bunch of psychotic
religious zealots for loving who he loved and being who he was, and
none of us can help loving who we love or being who we are, and a new
bunch of psychotic religious zealots sent him right back to his death
for being born where he was born, and having skin the color that it
was, as if he could have done anything about being born where he was
born and having skin the color that it was, as if that meant anything,
as if he was some kind of ping-pong ball, doomed to death at the hands
of religious zealots, and the only question was which gang of assholes
got him.

I could cry for that man. I've never met him, never heard him spin. I
could cry for him anyway. and Jen Lasher's sex video uploaded to the
Internet is supposed to be sad? no. it isn't sad. it's just silly. and
funny. anybody who lives a life where the worst thing that happens to
you is that people find out that you have sex? that is a good life.
that is an exceptionally good life.

you guys are making such a big deal out of this video, like it's such
a horrible thing. be realistic. be honest. the only really horrible
thing about that video is the cinematography. if we're going to treat
this video as a public disaster, then the real tragedy isn't that a
bunch of people saw Jen Lasher naked. the real tragedy is that Dara
doesn't own a tripod. those things are like twenty bucks.

I, Pilgrim on a Path of Wonder,
Mindful of the present moment,
Call the Universe my mother,
This Earth my home,
Nature my temple
And all Life my kin.
Celebrating life,
Accepting inevitible death, unafraid.
My guides:
Truth, Beauty, Kindness, Love, Gentleness, Fairness,
Openess, Curiousity, Wonder, Acceptance, Appreciation, Empathy,
Courage, Patience, Resolve, Humor, Reason, Common sense.
Almighty Reality my only God.

	sfraves@hyperreal.org
Mime-Version: 1.0

Content-Disposition: inline
User-Agent: Mutt/1.4.2.1i
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] NRR: Use it.

It's long-standing tradition on this list to include "NRR" in the
subject of messages that are Not Rave-Related. Doing so not only makes
it easy for subscribers to skip over messages that they're not
interested in, but also makes it easier to trash such messages
automatically.

Discussions concerning politics, people's sex lives, new business ideas,
or anything else that isn't even remotely relevant to raving should be
tagged accordingly, as a courtesy to the list's readers.

Thanks,
-- 
shawn allen
  mailto://shawn@alterior.net
  phone://+1.415.577.3961
  http://shazbotica.com
  aim://shawnpallen

and trustworthy in the press, with regards to corruption and extortion =

department of corrections. I am extremely scared! I have gone threw all =

or has outright said they can't get evolved at his point in their =
career, then advises me to never call them again. These are lawyer / =
judge contacts that are very afraid. I have an appointment with the FBI =
tomorrow and I have been told by others not to go until I have this to =
the press if anything happens to me.=20

This evolves the death of Phil Goldman founder of WebTV, MailBlocks, =
General Magic Apple Computer OS, VP Advanced TV Services Microsoft, =
Director of Communication Products at General Magic.=20

http://latc.com/2004/01/07/news/news02.html=20

Anyone who knows how to reach DJ Science (Alex) please forward this to =
him!=20

She's a friend of mine, and I look out for my friends.

so many people are so concerned with other people's lives ASIDE from their 
own, that they feel the need to dig into their personal bullshit to find 
entertainment. That just speaks volumes about how PATHETIC they are as 
humans.

Grow up.


----- Original Message ----- 
From: "Giles Soundwave" <dj.soundwave@gmail.com>
To: "Mary Morris" <morrism@washpost.com>
Cc: <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Sent: Tuesday, December 13, 2005 9:08 PM
Subject: Re: [sfraves] dj jen lasher: no more tears


I'm sorry, I just think this is funny. like it might be embarrassing,
and certainly I can understand people being upset about it, and yes,
ex-boyfriends are sometimes vicious bastards, but you live life like a
rock star, and then you're angry because you have an audience? come
on, get over yourselves. any one of us could have been born a peasant
in China or a slave in Kuwait. have some perspective. it isn't such a
big soap opera. a party girl partied. that isn't even news.

there was a DJ here in SF. the Bush Administration initiated
deportation proceedings against him because he was Pakistani. he's
gay. in Pakistan, homosexuality is a crime punishable by death. THAT
is sad. he came here to escape being killed by a bunch of psychotic
religious zealots for loving who he loved and being who he was, and
none of us can help loving who we love or being who we are, and a new
bunch of psychotic religious zealots sent him right back to his death
for being born where he was born, and having skin the color that it
was, as if he could have done anything about being born where he was
born and having skin the color that it was, as if that meant anything,
as if he was some kind of ping-pong ball, doomed to death at the hands
of religious zealots, and the only question was which gang of assholes
got him.

I could cry for that man. I've never met him, never heard him spin. I
could cry for him anyway. and Jen Lasher's sex video uploaded to the
Internet is supposed to be sad? no. it isn't sad. it's just silly. and
funny. anybody who lives a life where the worst thing that happens to
you is that people find out that you have sex? that is a good life.
that is an exceptionally good life.

you guys are making such a big deal out of this video, like it's such
a horrible thing. be realistic. be honest. the only really horrible
thing about that video is the cinematography. if we're going to treat
this video as a public disaster, then the real tragedy isn't that a
bunch of people saw Jen Lasher naked. the real tragedy is that Dara
doesn't own a tripod. those things are like twenty bucks.

Bam <invibe@gmail.com> wrote: Bush Steadfast on Iraq Despite Faulty Intel
- By NEDRA PICKLER, Associated Press Writer
Wednesday, December 14, 2005

(12-14) 08:38 PST WASHINGTON, (AP) --

President Bush accepted responsibility on Wednesday for the decision
to go to war with Iraq despite faulty intelligence but said the
decision to oust Saddam Hussein was still correct.

"It is true that much of the intelligence turned out to be wrong. As
president I am responsible for the decision to go into Iraq," the
president told The Woodrow Wilson Center on the eve of elections to
establish Iraq's first permanent, democratically elected government.
"And I'm also responsible for fixing what went wrong by reforming our
intelligence capabilities. And we're doing just that."

The president said Thursday's parliamentary elections in Iraq are a
watershed moment that will inspire democracy across the Middle East.
But with public opinion still running against his mission, Bush still
was left defending his decision to go to war nearly three years ago.

"We are in Iraq today because our goal has always been more than the
removal of brutal dictator," Bush said. "It is to leave a free and
democratic Iraq in his place.

"My decision to remove Saddam Hussein was the right decision. Saddam
was a threat and the American people and the world is better off
because he is no longer in power," the president said.

The speech was the last in a series of four presidential addresses
leading up to Thursday's vote.

As he usually does, Bush asserted that the Iraq of the future, with a
functioning democracy and thriving economy, would be a model for other
nations in the turbulent Middle East. But he added a specific
reference to the inspiration that a free Iraq could provide to
reformers in the region's two governments most hostile to the United
States  Syria and Iran.


URL: http://sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?file=/n/a/2005/12/14/national/w082941S18.DTL

----- Original Message ----
From: shawn allen <shawn@alterior.net>
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
Sent: Tuesday, December 13, 2005 13:51:29
Subject: [sfraves] NRR: Use it.

It's long-standing tradition on this list to include "NRR" in the
subject of messages that are Not Rave-Related. Doing so not only makes
it easy for subscribers to skip over messages that they're not
interested in, but also makes it easier to trash such messages
automatically.

Discussions concerning politics, people's sex lives, new business ideas,
or anything else that isn't even remotely relevant to raving should be
tagged accordingly, as a courtesy to the list's readers.

Thanks,
-- 
shawn allen
  mailto://shawn@alterior.net
  phone://+1.415.577.3961
  http://shazbotica.com
  aim://shawnpallen

> It's long-standing tradition on this list to include "NRR" in the
> subject of messages that are Not Rave-Related. Doing so not only makes
> it easy for subscribers to skip over messages that they're not
> interested in, but also makes it easier to trash such messages
> automatically.

> Discussions concerning politics, people's sex lives, new business  
> ideas,

Subject: Re: [sfraves] anyone else see tosca at mezzanine?


I duuno, maybe I am not as picky as you guys.. but I thought the show was 
pretty sweet.  Maybe bot what was promised, but on listening to the 
recording I made a few times, I wished I had had another disk.. cuz it just 
kept getting better and better.  That is of course relative since the first 
25 minutes was preety off cuff.. strange little piano set for sure.. but I 
liked the music.. but the crowd wouldn't shut up.. as the neighbors were 
saying "I think people were getting a little frustrated".. with the music.  
So my first time seeing them live.. I don't own any Tosca.. but I hear the 
first five cds rock.  Off to the store!

Happy holidays!

ps.  I heard about the show an hour before.. headed down and found a 
ticket.. you can do it too :)

much in despairing of life as in hoping for another life
& in eluding the implacable grandeur of this life.
-- Albert Camus -- *******************************************
**************************************************************

online at http://kzsulive.stanford.edu from now until noon pacific time.

To remind you about Lick The DJ:
Lick The DJ has been hanging with the likes of FnF, so you know he knows his 
acid lines.  He's also part of Lost Tribe (the Sweet parties) and he's part of 
Lick The Micron (a tagteam duo with Micron.)  Peep him at 
http://www.lickthedj.com to find out more.

You can expect to hear things in the tech-house, house and techno 
realms, mainly with that good acid line!!  If you have questions or 
comments, call us up at 650-723-9010, or chat with us on AIM at kzsudj.

Subject: [sfraves] NNR (but fun) - The Lag - Live in Oakland @ Stork Club Tonight
 (thursday)


The Lag (who have played chillits, fnf campout and west oakland's infamous
high tea events) are going out into the real world to mate with new
earholes.  Come hear what we sound like when we aren't worried about
sounding so damn chill.

The Lag Is:
andyw plays guitar
georgec plays bass
chrisp plays drums
andyw + georgec both sing

The Lag Loves:
alternating between paint curling feedback and soft vocal harmonies
inducing alpha patterns which create puddles of drool
dynamic peaks and valleys that frustrate sound engineers
bushmill's, bulldogs, soldering irons, driving ranges, you

we're on first at 9pm!!!
other bands playing (mostly powerpop/punk bidnis, should be very fun!):
One Size Fits All + Marisma + All Ages

$5 / 21+ / full bar action
stork club
2330 telegraph avenue
oakland, ca 94612

*** we fully understand that this mail is outside the usual charter of
this list, and most of our bookings/news won't be announced here.  if you
are interested in being added to our mailing list and joining the Lag
Comfy Armchair Militia (cd offers, shwag, bookings, news, etc!) just
respond back to me and I'll get you added.

Subject: [sfraves] NRR: Victory

--------------070403030706030007020309
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1; format=flowed
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit


      http://jameshowardkunstler.typepad.com/clusterfuck_nation/



      Victory

December 12, 2005
     What on earth does George W. Bush mean by /victory/? To remake Iraq 
in the image of Indiana?

    I suppose I am the 1,289,654th observer to note that the president 
does a poor job of articulating the goal of our military venture over 
there -- which is to defend our access to the oil of the Middle East.

     Incessantly flogging the word /freedom/ the past three years was 
probably his biggest mistake. It would have been more precise, modest, 
and useful to say that we were supporting elections under a new 
constitution (written with our assistance) because the alternative would 
be to just appoint a bunch of guys we liked to be a government -- and 
that government would have had no /legitimacy/ among the Iraqi people, 
not to mention the bawling of world opinion against it (and us). So, of 
course, elections were a necessity, and the policing required to make 
that happen has been an ugly struggle.

     Otherwise, the most conspicuous freedom in Iraq, for most Iraqis, 
the past three years has been freedom from reliable electrical service.

     But/ victory/? That's really a howler. Over what? The terrorists, I 
suppose, if you call the larger enterprise a War on Terror, another 
unfortunate locution. The fact is that there is a vast popular antipathy 
against the United States that emanates from west of Gibraltar clear 
across the eastern hemisphere to the south Pacific. In formal terms, it 
is an Islamic jihad. Its clear goal is to expel interlopers from Islamic 
territory. It imposes rather severe penalties on the perceived 
interlopers, and its tactics are not gentlemanly, especially where 
civilians are in the way.

     /Victory/ against this would seem to imply the extermination of at 
least tens of millions of Islamic young men, not a realistic goal. We 
are equally unlikely to charm them into a change of affection by 
demonstrating the art of elections.

      Getting back to the smaller theater of Iraq itself, we see a cast 
of characters arrayed against our presence: Shiites acting as proxies 
for neighboring Iran; former Baathists seeking crazily to regain 
control; Sunnis desperately trying to keep a hand in the oil revenue, 
since most of the oil lies in either Shiite or Kurdish territory; and of 
course there is probably a contingent of international jihadistas, young 
men from all over the Middle East and elsewhere, with no regular work 
except to harass and exasperate the infidel occupiers. There is 
certainly an inexhaustible supply of these young men. And an 
inexhaustible supply of munitions at their disposal. There is no chance 
whatsoever that we are going to pacify these warriors. They will not 
rest until we depart their /ummah/ and we are not going to do that until 
there is no oil left in it.

      So, /victory/ in any conventional sense that Americans understand 
this word is out of the question, and the President's use of it is his 
biggest blunder since the "mission accomplished" stunt of 2003. The Iraq 
elections may succeed in establishing a legitimate government -- but 
then what? Will it govern for a month and a half and fall apart? The 
eventual likely outcome, as everybody knows, is civil war in Iraq, and 
perhaps a widening conflict with Iran on one side, Syria on the other 
side, and Saudi Arabia left to the Jihadistas. Elsewhere in the world, 
things will continue to blow up.

     Meanwhile, back here in This Land is Your Land, the easy motoring 
utopia will remain non-negotiable and we'll drive Amtrak into bankruptcy.


--------------070403030706030007020309--

Subject: [sfraves] NRR: Nastiest BART ride ever...

------=_NextPart_000_00BE_01C60225.B6C69170

Ok,=20

So I ride BART every day, and you get used to the stinky homeless folks, =
and people who wouldn't know what soap was even if were crammed up their =
ass sideways. I've gotten used to the wanna be thugs, the =
pseudo-intellectual non-stop yappers, etc.=20

Today I transfer from McArthur towards Bay Point as I do every weekday =
AM. Normally my ride is very quiet. Not that many people heading out =
there, always half asleep or involved in their iPod or whatever.=20

Not this morning. Nope. I get on the train and 1st notice the stench of =
god knows what. Ok - so that's tolerable - not pleasant, but it's a =
relatively short ride to Lafayette, so I deal. Then I notice that =
everyone in the car near the doors are staring at the wall, obviously =
avoiding looking at something, awith looks of horror on their faces.

Gee - "whats that all about?" I wonder. So I look over, and on one of =
the seats near the door, a guy that looks like he's covered in either =
shit or vomit, has his hands crammed down his pants, and looks to be =
itching furiously. OK - that sufficiently disgusts me, but with homeless =
looking folks, I think I've seen worse. So I flip through tracks on my =
cd, and stop paying attention. Til I notice this woman sitting directly =
across from dude, and in my line of sight visibly GASPS, and gets up and =
moves. So, like curious little humans, a few of us turn our heads, and =
are greeted with...

The nasty dude FULL ON beating off. As if no one else is even there - =
he's like, INto the moment.=20

Needless to say, not fuckin cool AT ALL. You know - on the late night =
trains, I could almost see it happening and me not being too shocked - =
but at fuckin' 8:45am - it was a bit much.

Anyway - thought I'd share and traumatize the rest of you this morning =
;)

SHARE IN MY AGONY!
------=_NextPart_000_00BE_01C60225.B6C69170--

> always half asleep or involved in their iPod or whatever.
>
> Not this morning. Nope. I get on the train and 1st notice the stench of
> god knows what. Ok - so that's tolerable - not pleasant, but it's a
> relatively short ride to Lafayette, so I deal. Then I notice that everyone
> in the car near the doors are staring at the wall, obviously avoiding
> looking at something, awith looks of horror on their faces.
>
> Gee - "whats that all about?" I wonder. So I look over, and on one of the
> seats near the door, a guy that looks like he's covered in either shit or
> vomit, has his hands crammed down his pants, and looks to be itching
> furiously. OK - that sufficiently disgusts me, but with homeless looking
> folks, I think I've seen worse. So I flip through tracks on my cd, and 
> stop
> paying attention. Til I notice this woman sitting directly across from 
> dude,
> and in my line of sight visibly GASPS, and gets up and moves. So, like
> curious little humans, a few of us turn our heads, and are greeted with...
>
> The nasty dude FULL ON beating off. As if no one else is even there - he's
> like, INto the moment.
>
> Needless to say, not fuckin cool AT ALL. You know - on the late night
> trains, I could almost see it happening and me not being too shocked - but
> at fuckin' 8:45am - it was a bit much.
>
> Anyway - thought I'd share and traumatize the rest of you this morning ;)
>
> SHARE IN MY AGONY!
>



--
Nick Sideshow
---------------------------
http://www.hcftp.com
HCFTP/DisturbingTheScene

  On 12/16/05, Marc(O) <electrofunk138@hotmail.com> wrote:=20
    Ok,

    So I ride BART every day, and you get used to the stinky homeless =
folks, and people who wouldn't know what soap was even if were crammed =
up their ass sideways. I've gotten used to the wanna be thugs, the =
pseudo-intellectual non-stop yappers, etc.=20

    Today I transfer from McArthur towards Bay Point as I do every =
weekday AM. Normally my ride is very quiet. Not that many people heading =
out there, always half asleep or involved in their iPod or whatever.

    Not this morning. Nope. I get on the train and 1st notice the stench =
of god knows what. Ok - so that's tolerable - not pleasant, but it's a =
relatively short ride to Lafayette, so I deal. Then I notice that =
everyone in the car near the doors are staring at the wall, obviously =
avoiding looking at something, awith looks of horror on their faces.=20

    Gee - "whats that all about?" I wonder. So I look over, and on one =
of the seats near the door, a guy that looks like he's covered in either =
shit or vomit, has his hands crammed down his pants, and looks to be =
itching furiously. OK - that sufficiently disgusts me, but with homeless =
looking folks, I think I've seen worse. So I flip through tracks on my =
cd, and stop paying attention. Til I notice this woman sitting directly =
across from dude, and in my line of sight visibly GASPS, and gets up and =
moves. So, like curious little humans, a few of us turn our heads, and =
are greeted with...=20

    The nasty dude FULL ON beating off. As if no one else is even there =
- he's like, INto the moment.

    Needless to say, not fuckin cool AT ALL. You know - on the late =
night trains, I could almost see it happening and me not being too =
shocked - but at fuckin' 8:45am - it was a bit much.=20

    Anyway - thought I'd share and traumatize the rest of you this =
morning ;)

    SHARE IN MY AGONY!

On 12/16/05, Marc(O) <electrofunk138@hotmail.com> wrote:
>
> Ok,
>
> So I ride BART every day, and you get used to the stinky homeless folks,
> and people who wouldn't know what soap was even if were crammed up their =
ass
> sideways. I've gotten used to the wanna be thugs, the pseudo-intellectual
> non-stop yappers, etc.
>
> Today I transfer from McArthur towards Bay Point as I do every weekday AM=
.
> Normally my ride is very quiet. Not that many people heading out there,
> always half asleep or involved in their iPod or whatever.
>
> Not this morning. Nope. I get on the train and 1st notice the stench of
> god knows what. Ok - so that's tolerable - not pleasant, but it's a
> relatively short ride to Lafayette, so I deal. Then I notice that everyon=
e
> in the car near the doors are staring at the wall, obviously avoiding
> looking at something, awith looks of horror on their faces.
>
> Gee - "whats that all about?" I wonder. So I look over, and on one of the
> seats near the door, a guy that looks like he's covered in either shit or
> vomit, has his hands crammed down his pants, and looks to be itching
> furiously. OK - that sufficiently disgusts me, but with homeless looking
> folks, I think I've seen worse. So I flip through tracks on my cd, and st=
op
> paying attention. Til I notice this woman sitting directly across from du=
de,
> and in my line of sight visibly GASPS, and gets up and moves. So, like
> curious little humans, a few of us turn our heads, and are greeted with..=
.
>
> The nasty dude FULL ON beating off. As if no one else is even there - he'=
s
> like, INto the moment.
>
> Needless to say, not fuckin cool AT ALL. You know - on the late night
> trains, I could almost see it happening and me not being too shocked - bu=
t
> at fuckin' 8:45am - it was a bit much.
>
> Anyway - thought I'd share and traumatize the rest of you this morning ;)
>
> SHARE IN MY AGONY!

  On 12/16/05, Marc(O) <electrofunk138@hotmail.com> wrote:=20
    Ok,

    So I ride BART every day, and you get used to the stinky homeless =
folks, and people who wouldn't know what soap was even if were crammed =
up their ass sideways. I've gotten used to the wanna be thugs, the =
pseudo-intellectual non-stop yappers, etc.=20

    Today I transfer from McArthur towards Bay Point as I do every =
weekday AM. Normally my ride is very quiet. Not that many people heading =
out there, always half asleep or involved in their iPod or whatever.

    Not this morning. Nope. I get on the train and 1st notice the stench =
of god knows what. Ok - so that's tolerable - not pleasant, but it's a =
relatively short ride to Lafayette, so I deal. Then I notice that =
everyone in the car near the doors are staring at the wall, obviously =
avoiding looking at something, awith looks of horror on their faces.=20

    Gee - "whats that all about?" I wonder. So I look over, and on one =
of the seats near the door, a guy that looks like he's covered in either =
shit or vomit, has his hands crammed down his pants, and looks to be =
itching furiously. OK - that sufficiently disgusts me, but with homeless =
looking folks, I think I've seen worse. So I flip through tracks on my =
cd, and stop paying attention. Til I notice this woman sitting directly =
across from dude, and in my line of sight visibly GASPS, and gets up and =
moves. So, like curious little humans, a few of us turn our heads, and =
are greeted with...=20

    The nasty dude FULL ON beating off. As if no one else is even there =
- he's like, INto the moment.

    Needless to say, not fuckin cool AT ALL. You know - on the late =
night trains, I could almost see it happening and me not being too =
shocked - but at fuckin' 8:45am - it was a bit much.=20

    Anyway - thought I'd share and traumatize the rest of you this =
morning ;)

    SHARE IN MY AGONY!

On Fri, Dec 16, 2005 at 09:47:23AM -0800, Marc(O) wrote:
> Ok, 
> 
> So I ride BART every day, and you get used to the stinky homeless folks, and people who wouldn't know what soap was even if were crammed up their ass sideways. I've gotten used to the wanna be thugs, the pseudo-intellectual non-stop yappers, etc. 
> 
> Today I transfer from McArthur towards Bay Point as I do every weekday AM. Normally my ride is very quiet. Not that many people heading out there, always half asleep or involved in their iPod or whatever. 
> 
> Not this morning. Nope. I get on the train and 1st notice the stench of god knows what. Ok - so that's tolerable - not pleasant, but it's a relatively short ride to Lafayette, so I deal. Then I notice that everyone in the car near the doors are staring at the wall, obviously avoiding looking at something, awith looks of horror on their faces.
> 
> Gee - "whats that all about?" I wonder. So I look over, and on one of the seats near the door, a guy that looks like he's covered in either shit or vomit, has his hands crammed down his pants, and looks to be itching furiously. OK - that sufficiently disgusts me, but with homeless looking folks, I think I've seen worse. So I flip through tracks on my cd, and stop paying attention. Til I notice this woman sitting directly across from dude, and in my line of sight visibly GASPS, and gets up and moves. So, like curious little humans, a few of us turn our heads, and are greeted with...
> 
> The nasty dude FULL ON beating off. As if no one else is even there - he's like, INto the moment. 
> 
> Needless to say, not fuckin cool AT ALL. You know - on the late night trains, I could almost see it happening and me not being too shocked - but at fuckin' 8:45am - it was a bit much.
> 
> Anyway - thought I'd share and traumatize the rest of you this morning ;)
> 
> SHARE IN MY AGONY!

from people mastrubating on trains and pictures of people shot in the face...
 
 An old math professor of mine and some cohorts have recently demonstrated that there is a "correlation between aesthetics and fractal dimension and Lyapunov exponents" of visual patterns.
 
 Don't have any fucking idea what I'm talking about?  Don't worry about it, just check out the pretty pictures... 
 
 click here for an example: http://sheepserver.net/v2d6/cgi/node.cgi?id=19735 or here: http://draves.org/pix/frame3.cgi?zoom=1&dir=flames&file=102.jpg
 
 More information:
 
 http://electricsheep.org/
 http://www.vismath.org/research/sheep/
 
 For more on fractal flames and the flame renderer:
 
 http://flam3.com/
 
 Get the screen saver: http://flam3.com/index.cgi?&menu=download
 
 These might make a nice X-mas gift for someone...
 
 http://spotworks.com
 
 Anyway a lot better than a squirt in the eye from a homeless guy.
 
 Happy holidays,
 
 Peter
 
 P.S. If you download the screen saver, keep in mind that it takes longer than you expect to get your first "electric sheep"

> > So I ride BART every day, and you get used to the stinky homeless folks, 
> > and people who wouldn't know what soap was even if were crammed up their 
> > ass sideways. I've gotten used to the wanna be thugs, the 
> > pseudo-intellectual non-stop yappers, etc.

> > AM. Normally my ride is very quiet. Not that many people heading out 
> > there, always half asleep or involved in their iPod or whatever.
> >
> > Not this morning. Nope. I get on the train and 1st notice the stench of 
> > god knows what. Ok - so that's tolerable - not pleasant, but it's a 
> > relatively short ride to Lafayette, so I deal. Then I notice that 
> > everyone in the car near the doors are staring at the wall, obviously 
> > avoiding looking at something, awith looks of horror on their faces.
> >
> > Gee - "whats that all about?" I wonder. So I look over, and on one of 
> > the seats near the door, a guy that looks like he's covered in either 
> > shit or vomit, has his hands crammed down his pants, and looks to be 
> > itching furiously. OK - that sufficiently disgusts me, but with homeless 
> > looking folks, I think I've seen worse. So I flip through tracks on my 
> > cd, and stop paying attention. Til I notice this woman sitting directly 
> > across from dude, and in my line of sight visibly GASPS, and gets up and 
> > moves. So, like curious little humans, a few of us turn our heads, and 
> > are greeted with...
> >
> > The nasty dude FULL ON beating off. As if no one else is even there - 
> > he's like, INto the moment.
> >
> > Needless to say, not fuckin cool AT ALL. You know - on the late night 
> > trains, I could almost see it happening and me not being too shocked - 
> > but at fuckin' 8:45am - it was a bit much.
> >
> > Anyway - thought I'd share and traumatize the rest of you this morning 
> > ;)

Ok, first off, I'm not a troll. I'm an active member in this
community, and have been for a long ass time, and like other people on
here like to post my opinions, but it just so happens that my opinions
don't coincide with the majority here.

Secondly, my whole post was done as a joke, making fun of the
"open-mindedness, liberalism" here. Hell no would I be accepting of
some dude exposing himself and masterbating in front of me.

Maybe I am stupid Marco, or maybe I just look at things differently
then you. I just want to give people something to think about from the
other side.

> Anyway a lot better than a squirt in the eye from a homeless guy.

Date: Fri, 16 Dec 2005 13:59:00 -0800 (PST)
From: <dangrsmind@yahoo.com>
Reply-To: dangrsmind@yahoo.com
To: The Twilight Laser Outpost <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
In-Reply-To: <96e151a20512161316s75426ab9g10dd07c621ba25eb@mail.gmail.com>
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] Troll alert!

Well that's BS.
 
 From Wikipedia, 
 
 "In Internet terminology, a troll is a person who posts inflammatory messages on the internet, such as on online discussion forums, to disrupt discussion or to upset its participants. 'Troll' can also mean the inflammatory message itself posted by a troll or be a verb meaning to post such messages. 'Trolling' (the gerund) is also commonly used to describe the activity."
 
 This definition tells us that it is the intent of the posting (to disrupt or inflame) that makes a person or posting a troll, rather than their membership or lack thereof in the community of interest.  To be careful, it should be acknowledged that it is the *percieved* intent of the poster that makes others see them and their postings as trolls.
 
 Steve, you may feel that you are merely a member of this community with unpopular or misunderstood views, but other members are perceiving  that your intention in posting is merely to inflame or disrupt this list.  You might want to consider why that would be the case and how you might go about changing that perception.  
 
 Or not.  Whatever.
 
 Regards,
 
 Peter

Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR: Nastiest BART ride ever...

The actions and priorities of people whom one would probably not call 
"liberal" have amplified the creation of a large underclass of 
untouchables in a nation that used to be a land of hope.

Most people look straight through the homeless, and certainly don't 
talk to them.  They aren't there, so to speak.  So this guy on a train 
where everybody wishes he were not there feels like an invisible 
outsider.  Further, he has no private space anywhere.  In a sense, he 
was alone and masturbating in private.

For a long time I gave a little money to homeless people, but always 
folded it lengthwise, so I could give it to them without touching them. 
  I would give them something and walk away quickly.  Eventually I 
learned from their eyes that what they wanted much more than a dollar 
was a hand to shake and somebody to look them in the eye and talk for a 
moment or two, as if there were two human beings present.  Now I carry 
a little bottle of alcohol in my pocket to clean my hands, and touching 
homeless people is less of a problem.  There hasn't been any need to 
give up my precious middle-class cleanliness.

The pseudo-Christians who have hijacked the government are leaving the 
homeless to rot in the streets.  What would Jesus do if he had been 
sitting with you on that BART car?  He would likely have gone over and 
sat down next to the guy jacking off, who would have pulled up his 
trousers a little sheepishly and started talking with the unexpected 
person acknowledging his humanity.  The hideous moment would have 
passed and been replaced by a pleasant astonishment that it was so easy 
to take things somewhere else.  Anybody on the car could have done that.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR: Nastiest BART ride ever...

I'm not a Christian, and quite frankly am not too concerned with what Jesus 
would do. Just like a child who wants attention and will do anything, even 
bad things to get attention, you can't just coddle them "because". If he 
wanted attention that bad he could've struck up a conversation with someone 
just like half the homeless folks who ride BART, whom I will actually talk 
to like any other human being. But pulling out his cock and jacking off is 
just foul. Sorry.

Call me heartless, but I don't buy into that being something we should all 
be forced to embrace with open arms to make us "caring" people.

While I  agree with you wholeheartedly about human contact and the homeless, its important to remember that you not only need to have the desire and motivation to help someone, but also knowledge of the skilful means which can help them.  I'd say its not obvious how to help someone that is mastrubating in public on a train, and that while perhaps Jesus or Buddha or Ghandi or someone wiser than me might have been able to skilfully resolve this situation, the rest of us mere mortals would have simply got a lapful of jizz.
 
 Regards,
 
 Peter

----- Original Message ----
From: Will Grant <will@greyotter.com>
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
Sent: Friday, December 16, 2005 14:18:47
Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR: Nastiest BART ride ever...

The actions and priorities of people whom one would probably not call 
"liberal" have amplified the creation of a large underclass of 
untouchables in a nation that used to be a land of hope.

Most people look straight through the homeless, and certainly don't 
talk to them.  They aren't there, so to speak.  So this guy on a train 
where everybody wishes he were not there feels like an invisible 
outsider.  Further, he has no private space anywhere.  In a sense, he 
was alone and masturbating in private.

For a long time I gave a little money to homeless people, but always 
folded it lengthwise, so I could give it to them without touching them. 
  I would give them something and walk away quickly.  Eventually I 
learned from their eyes that what they wanted much more than a dollar 
was a hand to shake and somebody to look them in the eye and talk for a 
moment or two, as if there were two human beings present.  Now I carry 
a little bottle of alcohol in my pocket to clean my hands, and touching 
homeless people is less of a problem.  There hasn't been any need to 
give up my precious middle-class cleanliness.

The pseudo-Christians who have hijacked the government are leaving the 
homeless to rot in the streets.  What would Jesus do if he had been 
sitting with you on that BART car?  He would likely have gone over and 
sat down next to the guy jacking off, who would have pulled up his 
trousers a little sheepishly and started talking with the unexpected 
person acknowledging his humanity.  The hideous moment would have 
passed and been replaced by a pleasant astonishment that it was so easy 
to take things somewhere else.  Anybody on the car could have done that.

On 12/16/05, dangrsmind@yahoo.com <dangrsmind@yahoo.com> wrote:
>
> Well that's BS.
>
> From Wikipedia,
>
> "In Internet terminology, a troll is a person who posts inflammatory
> messages on the internet, such as on online discussion forums, to disrupt
> discussion or to upset its participants. 'Troll' can also mean the
> inflammatory message itself posted by a troll or be a verb meaning to pos=
t
> such messages. 'Trolling' (the gerund) is also commonly used to describe =
the
> activity."
>
> This definition tells us that it is the intent of the posting (to disrupt
> or inflame) that makes a person or posting a troll, rather than their
> membership or lack thereof in the community of interest.  To be careful, =
it
> should be acknowledged that it is the *percieved* intent of the poster th=
at
> makes others see them and their postings as trolls.
>
> Steve, you may feel that you are merely a member of this community with
> unpopular or misunderstood views, but other members are perceiving  that
> your intention in posting is merely to inflame or disrupt this list.  You
> might want to consider why that would be the case and how you might go ab=
out
> changing that perception.
>
> Or not.  Whatever.
>
> Regards,
>
> Peter

On Fri, 16 Dec 2005, Will Grant wrote:
-&e->The pseudo-Christians who have hijacked the government are leaving the
-&e->homeless to rot in the streets.  What would Jesus do if he had been sitting
-&e->with you on that BART car?  He would likely have gone over and sat down
-&e->next to the guy jacking off

And been told "mrrrrmm, um, kinda busy... gimme a few seconds here, I'm 
almost done".

The social pressure of being surrounded by strangers + risk of arrest, etc 
should be greater than the will to spank that monkey.  But it was 
happening.  The guy was either crazy or high (aka temporarily crazy).  
Assuming a given stimulus would be met with rational response is well, 
irrational.

As for WWJD?  Well if said person (let's call him Handy) was in the temple 
with the moneychangers, Jesus woulda kicked Handy out with them.  If Handy 
was hanging out with the woman at the well, he'd tell her "Lady, you got 5 
husbands and you need to stop seeing that married man... and WHAT THE 
HEYNOW?!?! quit jerking off you sick monkey, it's bad enough my father can 
see people doing that anywhere they go, but you're not even trying to be 
slick about it!!!  *shakes head* so where were we?".  If Handy was coming 
up to Jesus while he was mourning the passing of Lazarus and considering 
reincarnating him, I'm thinking he might lose his temper for a second and 
we'd see some lightning/brimstone/pillar of salt action.

C'mon Will.  I know and understand the "turn the other cheek" & beatitudes 
benevolent loving god, but let's not forget the genocidal wrathful side 
(earth's entire population - one boatload drowned, whole cities and 
nations, eldest son, etc).

andyw

p.s.	sorry to anybody I might be offending, but I wasn't the one who 
put Jesus and Handy on the same BART car.

> The actions and priorities of people whom one would probably not call
> "liberal" have amplified the creation of a large underclass of
> untouchables in a nation that used to be a land of hope.

> talk to them.  They aren't there, so to speak.  So this guy on a train
> where everybody wishes he were not there feels like an invisible
> outsider.  Further, he has no private space anywhere.  In a sense, he
> was alone and masturbating in private.
>
> For a long time I gave a little money to homeless people, but always
> folded it lengthwise, so I could give it to them without touching them.
>   I would give them something and walk away quickly.  Eventually I
> learned from their eyes that what they wanted much more than a dollar
> was a hand to shake and somebody to look them in the eye and talk for a
> moment or two, as if there were two human beings present.  Now I carry
> a little bottle of alcohol in my pocket to clean my hands, and touching
> homeless people is less of a problem.  There hasn't been any need to
> give up my precious middle-class cleanliness.
>
> The pseudo-Christians who have hijacked the government are leaving the

> person acknowledging his humanity.  The hideous moment would have

> to take things somewhere else.  Anybody on the car could have done that.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Troll alert! Re: [sfraves] NRR: Nastiest BART ride ever...

Marco, before you get sand in your vagina again, I have a few words to
say to you. I think you take yourself WAY too seriously. You're
forgetting that you're living in the bay area, one of the most
culturally diverse cities in the united states, let alone the world.
You preach about equality and diversity, but yet I've yet to see you
NOT jump down someone's throat because someone has a different opinion
than you do. You and I might never agree on politics. In fact, I can
guarantee that we won't. However, you seem to be the first one to
ALWAYS jump down someone's throat when someone has something different
to say than how you think. That's not showing much for diversity.
Calling me a suburb kid without even knowing my family history, or
where I came from? not cool. And even if that be the case, everyone's
entitled to their opinions, and has the right to open their obnoxious
noise holes just as much as you open yours. Again, I have nothing
against you. I really don't know you and I think I've only met you
maybe a couple of times. However, the elitist tone you take with
others, and the drama-mine way you go about it, intentionally stirring
the pot with people when they state their opinion really bothers me.
It's just hurtful and mean, and I think you should really think about
what you say before you say it.

Ya'll are in the slacker capital of the world. Why the hell do ya'll
need to get so goddamn aggro?

I got back on this list to keep in touch with friends. not watch
thread after thread about "FUCK BUSH!" "FUCK BLAH BLAH BLAH" "YOU DO
DRUGS OH MY GOD!!", etc. It's hypocritical.

I want to know about raves, listen to mixes and songs that people
make, and crack jokes with friends. you're all taking this shit WAY
too seriously. For fuck's sake, it's email. stop it.

Oh, and btw:

Raves were dead long before I started going to them. Good thing the
music's gotten better.

Marco, before you get sand in your vagina again, I have a few words to
say to you. I think you take yourself WAY too seriously. You're
forgetting that you're living in the bay area, one of the most
culturally diverse cities in the united states, let alone the world.
You preach about equality and diversity, but yet I've yet to see you
NOT jump down someone's throat because someone has a different opinion
than you do. You and I might never agree on politics. In fact, I can
guarantee that we won't. However, you seem to be the first one to
ALWAYS jump down someone's throat when someone has something different
to say than how you think. That's not showing much for diversity.
Calling me a suburb kid without even knowing my family history, or
where I came from? not cool. And even if that be the case, everyone's
entitled to their opinions, and has the right to open their obnoxious
noise holes just as much as you open yours. Again, I have nothing
against you. I really don't know you and I think I've only met you
maybe a couple of times. However, the elitist tone you take with
others, and the drama-mine way you go about it, intentionally stirring
the pot with people when they state their opinion really bothers me.
It's just hurtful and mean, and I think you should really think about
what you say before you say it.

Ya'll are in the slacker capital of the world. Why the hell do ya'll
need to get so goddamn aggro?

I got back on this list to keep in touch with friends. not watch
thread after thread about "FUCK BUSH!" "FUCK BLAH BLAH BLAH" "YOU DO
DRUGS OH MY GOD!!", etc. It's hypocritical.

I want to know about raves, listen to mixes and songs that people
make, and crack jokes with friends. you're all taking this shit WAY
too seriously. For fuck's sake, it's email. stop it.

Oh, and btw:

Raves were dead long before I started going to them. Good thing the
music's gotten better.

From: "Van Mundegaarde" <electrofunk138@hotmail.com>

Bcc: 
Date: Fri, 16 Dec 2005 18:00:18 -0800
Mime-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; format=flowed

X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] Troll alert! Re: [sfraves] NRR: Nastiest BART ride ever...

Well, I had some time to ponder Mr. Dee's remarks on my (masturbatory free) 
BART ride home...and this is what I've come up with.

Bear in mind that I've already responded (civilly I should hope) to John 
off-list, so this is sort of an "in general" response. (please correct me if 
I'm wrong about being civil in my response John)

1st off, on the subject of me taking myself seriously. I kind of find that 
funny, as I tend to see myself more as the "class clown" or "smart ass" more 
than I take myself seriously. Nine times out of ten, I am in fact (as he 
pointed out) "stirring the pot" just to see what people say. I have to 
actually take my hat off to John for having the cajones to actually stick it 
to me and not come off sounding like a twat. Do I agree with his 
observations? Not really. Do I respect him for having his opinion? Fully. Is 
he right? That's a matter of personal taste. I'm sure folks like Steve and 
Giles, whom I gave loads of shit this week were doing cartwheels after 
reading that - and good for them! As much as I don't agree with any of what 
they spouted off, they deserve to have a laugh at my expense too.

One of the things I keep noticing being insinuated about me though is, that 
I'm a liberal. I'm actually not. I think most liberal opinions or ideas are 
just as silly as most conservative ideas. I'm way more "middle of the road", 
at least in my own feeling. As far as my stance on equality and diversity - 
you're damn right I believe in both. Does that mean I'm a hypocrite for 
shit-talking people of opposing opinions? Well - when their opinions are 
neither pro-equlaity or pro-diversity, I would say not. Just because I 
believe in those ideals, doesn't mean I then support people who DON'T. That 
would make me pretty fucking wishy-washy, now wouldn't it? But again - it's 
only my crappy opinion. I'm not telling anyone to buy into the horseshit 
that I spew, lol.

Now - John wants to hear about "raves" and "music" and whatnot. That's 
fine...but then he might have taken the time to point out that I happen to 
comment on those subjects quite frequently. I'm one of the VERY few DJ's I 
know that actually takes the time to be courteous enough to thank the people 
that book me, and review their parties. When someone asks for sources for 
buying music, who's one of the 1st folks to spout off LISTS of places to 
find music? When discussions of gear happen, I try and throw my limited 
knowledge in. John - if you want more music talk - by all means, start a 
thread and let's do it to it!

Are you seeing a  basic pattern emerge here though? Well, I'll spell it out 
- I comment on EVERYTHING!!! Life interests me! Politics, music, raves, 
cooking, living, breathing...you name it, I comment on it all, because I 
live life as fully as I can. I'm interacting with people - for good or for 
bad. But I'm not going to apologize for that, and I'm not ashamed of it.

On that note - I'll leave you all be for the evening, hehehe - have fun 
doing whatever you all are doing tonight and this weekend. Tonight I'm 
taking it easy, and getting ready for a good long 6 hour tattoo session 
tomorrow at Temple Tattoo in Oakland. Rest assured next week my political 
commentary will be at least minimized in favor of gushing about my new ink 
and the upcoming New Year's festivities!!!

ez folks,
Marco

Tribenet:   <http://people.tribe.net/djapollo2k>http://people.tribe.net/djapollo2k 

Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.org
                
House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

"Look at every path closely and deliberately.  Try it as many times as you think necessary.  Then ask yourself and yourself alone one question.  This question is one that only a very old man asks.  My benefactor told me about it once when I was young and my blood was too vigorous for me to understand it.  Now I do understand it.  I will tell you what it is:  'Does this path have a heart?' If it does the path is good.  If it doesn't, it is of no use."
-Don Juan

"A nation of sheep will beget a government of wolves."
-Edward R. Murrow

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

----- Original Message ----
From: AndyW <andy@saturn5.com>
To: Will Grant <will@greyotter.com>
Cc: sfraves@hyperreal.org
Sent: Friday, December 16, 2005 15:28:34
Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR: Nastiest BART ride ever...


On Fri, 16 Dec 2005, Will Grant wrote:
-&e->The pseudo-Christians who have hijacked the government are leaving the
-&e->homeless to rot in the streets.  What would Jesus do if he had been sitting
-&e->with you on that BART car?  He would likely have gone over and sat down
-&e->next to the guy jacking off

And been told "mrrrrmm, um, kinda busy... gimme a few seconds here, I'm 
almost done".

The social pressure of being surrounded by strangers + risk of arrest, etc 
should be greater than the will to spank that monkey.  But it was 
happening.  The guy was either crazy or high (aka temporarily crazy).  
Assuming a given stimulus would be met with rational response is well, 
irrational.

As for WWJD?  Well if said person (let's call him Handy) was in the temple 
with the moneychangers, Jesus woulda kicked Handy out with them.  If Handy 
was hanging out with the woman at the well, he'd tell her "Lady, you got 5 
husbands and you need to stop seeing that married man... and WHAT THE 
HEYNOW?!?! quit jerking off you sick monkey, it's bad enough my father can 
see people doing that anywhere they go, but you're not even trying to be 
slick about it!!!  *shakes head* so where were we?".  If Handy was coming 
up to Jesus while he was mourning the passing of Lazarus and considering 
reincarnating him, I'm thinking he might lose his temper for a second and 
we'd see some lightning/brimstone/pillar of salt action.

C'mon Will.  I know and understand the "turn the other cheek" & beatitudes 
benevolent loving god, but let's not forget the genocidal wrathful side 
(earth's entire population - one boatload drowned, whole cities and 
nations, eldest son, etc).

andyw

p.s.    sorry to anybody I might be offending, but I wasn't the one who 
put Jesus and Handy on the same BART car.

Subject: [sfraves] SFRaves Calendar 121605


SPECIAL NOTICE:
Are you a self-proclaimed Technical Geek who is a Development Guru? Might 
you / your colleagues be interested in becoming involved with the next 
generation of the SFRaves Calendar Project?

The SFRaves Calendar is located @ 
http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar2

More information about Zope is located here: http://www.zope.org
All interested parties should have a solid understanding of and 
development experience with authoring and building applications using the 
Zope application framework, ZPT, Python, PHP, MYSQL. Plone and other 
languages that might be used to enhance the SFR Calendar Application.

Please note if you are seeing issues with the current calendar incarnation 
(bugs, errors, etc) please note that I am aware of them and am currently 
in the process of addressing / fixing these issues.

Please send responses to karina@hyperreal.org

Alternative solutions are also being considered for the next generation of 
this codebase. This includes other languages specific to the development 
of applications in a web environment.

CoSM ~ NYC/LA) Aaron (PDX) Djunya (DubScouts ~ UT). Sound by Spiritual 
Technology & EarthPulse Productions. Tickets are $50 for the weekend or 
$30 for Sat. only. We have Scott Huckabay flying in from the Pyramids in 
Egypt where he will be on tour, he'll be playing a very specail NYE set 
from 10pm -midnite. With incense burning between strings, wearing bells on 
his right ankle, the passionate ritual begins. The stage echoes, rolling 
like thunder under his bare feet, pounding a mesmerizing heartbeat. 
Dancing in a circle, shaking his dolphin guitar like a shaman shaking his 
magic medicine rattle, he lifts the guitar to his lips and howls the 
ancient cries from the deepest seas, leading us on a mesmerizing journey." 
We are also honored to have Planet Pulse perform for us on Friday & 
Saturday..."Planet Pulse performs original songs and spoken word. "natural 
blending and bending of musical styles". A mix of reggae, latin, 
gypsy-jazz & blues rock, come together with a unity that creates a unique 
and compelling musical experience. Jack Shields is a keeper of the faith. 
A living voice in the long, unbroken chain of voices connecting us 
directly to those people gathered around fires, as the drums played and 
people dancing with wild abandon, Vocalist Billie Shields has a commanding 
voice with a touch of Grace Slick in her delivery..."*Bring* warm clothes 
sleeping bag flashlight Food good vibes trash bags

suggest trying to share a room with friends or make local reservations at 
the closet motel. www.motel6.com in Weed, Ca 10 mins away. If you have any 
questions regarding NYE please contact earthpulse@sbcglobal.net Thank 
you****Please* don't bring Dogs.. seriously, its winter & NO dogs inside 
rooms, the AF or CH you will be charged for the cleaning bill.. This is an 
18+ event, under 18 accompanied by adult only!. NO ALCOHOL NO DRUGS NO 
GLASS BOTTLES NO FIRES. PLEASE respect our Earth & pack out what you bring 
in... Thank You.Namaste. schedule of events will be announced soon

Saturday, December 31st, 2005 Saturday, December 31st: New Years Eve 2006

Opel presents Infuse NYE: The Rekindling of Hope

After 4 years of being involved in NYE parties, we've managed to inoculate
ourselves from the lemon/amateur factor by keeping the party focused on
being a vibe centric community gathering, with a reasonable cover and our
neo-hippy values in full effect. This NYE, will look forward to creating a
wonderful, friendly, intimate party environment where we can all go big
together. A sanctuary of music, vibe, and people on NYE. w/ special guests:

goodies and some surprises...9pm- till you stop dancing DNA Lounge 375 11th
St. @ Harrison St. Pre-sales start at only $25 friends, on sale now @
www.opelproductions.com. Let's take a conscious, purposeful step together
into the New Year, and have an absolutely rockin time doing it. That sounds
like a proper end to a proper beginning....

Brett James vs. Sal DJ vs. Plate Tektonics (Cal Trance), Kid Wicked (Tunnel
Visionz), and Owl (Seekr). Jungle and Breaks Gym: Channel Surfer (F-8,
Firetribe), The Doctor (Bayraves), DOS, Aaron Jae (Evil Breaks), Nick Nyquil
(Oneiromancy), Reclipse (Drum Syndicate), and BAM (Evil Breaks). Happy Play
Ground: D-Unit vs. Riff Raff (Zapatistas/Hard Heads), Secondbase, Happy
Freaks (Hi-C, vs. Kid Orange, vs. Crackerjack), Sideshow (HCFTP), Rye Bread
(HCFTP), DJ Spell (Hard Heads), and Precision (Hard Heads). $20 at the door,
9pm-5am, All ages, San Francisco. Info line: 415.267.6921

************************************************
SFRaves Calendar Stats:
************************************************
http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar2/

2005-12-16 : SFRaves Calendar Stats:

* User Registration has skyrocketed to 372 groups and 2829 people as of 
December 2005!

-------------------------------------------------
Administrative Notes
-------------------------------------------------

THE SFRaves.org Calendar is sent via email every week.
To subscribe to the list, send a message to:
sfraves-calendar-subscribe@hyperreal.org

To remove your address from the list, send a message to:
sfraves-calendar-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org

Send mail to the following for info and FAQ for this list:
sfraves-calendar-info@hyperreal.org or sfraves-calendar-faq@hyperreal.org

If you have events to add to the SFRaves calendar, please publish them by
Friday @ Noon to be included in the SFR Calendar Weekly Edition Mailing.

SFRaves is a not for profit entity serving the Bay Area & all forms of
electronic music for 13 years.


---------------------------------------------------------------------
To unsubscribe, e-mail: sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org
For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

Together as One in los angeles.
The lineup isn't quite as bomb as I'd like -- the main room is all trance,
which is great to listen to but phhhbt for dancing :(

anyway, the lady friend whinged and whinged that she wants to go to
something huge for new years, and if huge is the primary qualifier... well,
it doesn't get much phatter than that. on this coast, at least.

actually, i was just skimming the lineup. All the drum and bass is like.
Tech-step. And.. buh. Maybe I should just stay in the bay area. I haven't
bought my tickets yet....

...but who wants to spend NYE in a grimy warehouse? I mean, grimy warehouse=
s
are great and all but.... /AND/ the ravers in LA are so refreshingly naive
and tarded out, as compared to the drunk and disorderly jadeatorium up here=
.

there's got to be another option.

i think im channelling geri. or osteen.

with no point,

sean

> of like family, too.  have you ever wondered how long the list and  
> hyperreal will last?  do you think brian will throw in the towel  
> someday or will there still be an sfraves 50 years from now?
>
> some of the reasons i started my fogforum list is i noticed more  
> and more i was forwarding messages to friends and family, so this  
> was just an easier way to do that.  i didn't really so much think  
> about the 'forum' part, i guess i could call it something else, but  
> i kind of like the name, so i'm keeping it.
>
> just some of my thoughts.
>
> tony
>

On 12/14/05, georgeC | origami <newstylesound@yahoo.com> wrote:
> I don't know, Shawn, I'm not sure you should broach this subject here- yo=
u might get poked/shit on/beat up while you spin!
>
>  THIS IS THE SFR WE HAVE TODAY.  WHERE DID WE GO WRONG?!!!?!?!?
>
>  hahahaha ;)
>
>  Yeah folks, plz kthx use NRR.
>
>  -GC
>

Just come out of the closet, dude. Your friends can tell and they
accept you. I can tell and I accept you. The only difference between
your friends and myself is that you're nice to your friends, so you've
earned their affection and their patience. You haven't been nice to
me, which means you haven't earned my affection or my patience, but I
feel kind of generous, so you can have both anyway. Merry Christmas. I
wish you the best.

Closet cases hardly ever think precisely, because most of their mental
energy goes towards avoiding the obvious, so, for the record, I never
threatened your golden boy. I described a series of horrible
transgressions against him and then asked him to imagine how he would
feel if I committed those humiliating transgressions in *public* and
apologized to him in *private*. That was all I did. The "threats" came
from his imagination, and his inability to read an entire sentence and
hold the whole thing in RAM at one time. The sole purpose of the
exercise was to make him pay attention to how vile, corporate, and
irresponsible he was being. That's all. That's it. I'm no threat to
him. He has less to fear from me than he does from the common
doormouse.

"Why riddle his body with bullets when I can set his soul on fire with
a slanderous mambo?"

Those of you who *did* read the original e-mail precisely may remember
I intended to unsubscribe. You may wonder if I still hold that
intention. I assure you, I do. I just needed to be sure sfraves would
permit me to leave.

If you've been here a while, you might have noticed that I've left
before, and just been drawn back, as if sfraves were the Death Star
and it held me in some kind of tractor beam. Even when dwelling miles
away, I've been unable to make an unsub stick. This time around, it's
different.

There's a bit in "Animal House" where John Belushi is utterly appalled
by his comrades' acceptance of defeat. His eyes bug out of his head,
and he goes, "Over? Did he say over?! NOTHING IS OVER UNTIL *WE*
DECIDE IT IS!"

We have decided: it is over.

We are done.

We sincerely apologize for the mess, and particularly for all the
smoking craters in the landscape.


Giles








ps -- we give you permission to interpret that as the royal we, if you
wish. it isn't quite how we intend it, but whatever. you may wonder if
we have gone completely insane. to be fair, we have certainly wondered
the same thing.

















pps -- sorry, I do have to add, "NRR" belongs to the mid 90s. all
modern e-mail applications can perform much more sophisticated
automated filtering than that. your request, Mr. Allen, is somewhere
between five to ten years behind the times. Thanks.

> Sent: Tuesday, December 13, 2005 13:51:29
> Subject: [sfraves] NRR: Use it.
>
> It's long-standing tradition on this list to include "NRR" in the
> subject of messages that are Not Rave-Related. Doing so not only makes
> it easy for subscribers to skip over messages that they're not
> interested in, but also makes it easier to trash such messages
> automatically.
>
> Discussions concerning politics, people's sex lives, new business ideas,
> or anything else that isn't even remotely relevant to raving should be
> tagged accordingly, as a courtesy to the list's readers.
>
> Thanks,

Subject: [sfraves] Weekend Review.. Family Weekend!!! : )

Friday Night: Telic Reunion :)

OK.. so went Candy on Friday night & ya know.. it was the best time!!! 
Really!!  Like it this mondo Family Thing & alot of us haven't seen each
other all 2gether like that in a looooong time!  So I told JonnyR 2 come
w/ me & we went!

OK, the venue it was @ in Oakland.. WOW!!  I mean.. it was small, there
were only about like 80 people there @ most.. but it was Dope!!  2
rooms... an outside smoking area... it kinda remeinded me of Overworld the
way Overworld was set up.. if some of u remember that place :)

Music that played was ummm.. OK.. we got there.. there was some like kinda
deep housey stuff playin.. Ummmm.. breaks followed after that... Jungle
after that a la The Doctor... Ummm... the big room opened up... hard nrg
played, Trance... oh oh oh.. then there was this like Slide show goin' on
& I happen 2 B in alot the pictures.. so like when a picture came up w/ me
wearin my top hat & I was in the room ('cause I wore my top hat on Friday
night), then people started like yelling & shit.. LoL... It was funny,,
Hello 2Day :)

Overall, it was a Groovy night.. caught up w/ alota people I Love & MIssed
so much, danced my ass off like there was no tomorrow, and just had fun!!!
 Probably more fun than i shoulda had, but fuck man.. it was just a wicked
time & when im Rome :)  LOLOLOLOLOLMAO.... HELLO 2DAY! :O)

Saturday Night: Jungle Fam, videos, 1015, Shadow Lounge :)

OK.. lastnight night was interesting... like the day b4, Mz Kitty & I were
planning our Sat night plans... so when Sat night rolls around.. well.. I
ditched out of a house warming in the City i planned on being @, but
'cause of the rain & walking 2 the bus stop, I didn't go :(

But night time came around, I had a ride 2 the bus stop.. hoped on BART,
got 2 Berk, Adrianna mentioned she was gonna nap until i got 2 Berk.. but
when i got 2 her place, no 1 answerd.. so i figured she needed her sleep &
went 2 the City by myself...

OK.. not this is a trip.. like there was a gas leak or something on the
bart train & it hella smelled in my train... this was all like announced
on the train intercome thingies when the BART train was stopped in the
middle of the tube underwater got like almost 20 minutes or something like
that!  Freeeeeaky shit!  Then there was ths fight between two dudes in the
next train over.. interesting!!!

So Logistics over @ El Ricon was fuckin' Dope!!!  I mean.. it was Wicked
bein' w/ the Jungle Fam.. YAY!!  Needless 2 say.. the energy of the whole
night was just fuckin' Sick as Hell!!!  Loved it!

When i got there... Mal & Sharp were on the decks tearing up spinng hella
hard jungle, some liquid, alota yummy dubby stuff I Love!!  Logistics went
on next!!  OOOOH MY GOSH!!!  He well.. from what i remember, started out
light i guess, w/ the Atmo Jungle, went hard & just pretty much stayed
hard the rest of his set & went Raga a bit!!  Loved Loved Loved it!! 
Gridlok went on next & spun this fuckin' Awesome set.. he did some live
shit off his computer, spun records, & played CDs... WOW... & it was
Sick!!!  Method one went on after him & played oh gosh.. it was a yummy
set!

After El Ricon.. went over 2 the the Timevala warehouse & watched vid,
after that, went 2 Al & Maz's pad after.. then instead of waiting 4 bart 2
open from their pad, I thought about getting food & hangin' out @ Shadow 4
the Sunday morning thing :)  So i cut outta there around 4:30ish then
ended up @ 1015.. LOL.. ok.. it was Trance on all floors.. LOL.. so
funny... yeah... kinda etarded out like in the club.. LoL... so i just 1st
kicked it w/ a few bar backs & security homies there.. then I saw my
homegirl Mina there, so we just kicked it & talk shit 4 like 2 hours:)

around 6:30, i went over 2 Shadow 4 the Sunday thing... LoL.. met soem
Groovy people there... hmmm... I dunno.. i wasn't really diggin' the house
there, so i just took out my notebook & wrote... but it was Dope!!  Saw
Vlad there & we talked 4 a bit !!  Love U Dude :)

Cut outta there around quater to 8.. i was kinda hungry.. so i went 2
BURGER KING & had some breakfast!  YUM!  LOLOLOLMAO.. Hello 2day..
Buuuurger Keng!  LMAO!

YAY!!  It was a fun weekend!!!  OK.. gotta do my homework.. or try 2!

Hop y'all had a Good Weekend! :)

-- 
Take Care <3
Peace=->Jus' Me =-> ObY {8O)

Saturday, January 21st 2006::::
   DEF, First Light & Evil Breaks present:::::


                        ++++Forces of Nature: Earth++++
  .....the old school meets the new school in a mid-winter celebration 
of nature!


Downstairs:::

Denise (DJ Denise.com)  trance/house/progressive
Disconnect (DEF)  techno
Forest Green (Sister, Daily City Records, DEF) electro  **just added!**
Mac Vaughn (aka DJ Uphonic)  electro
Macadio (First Light)  techno/progressive
Micron (Viberation, Friends & Family)  techno/acid


Upstairs:::

Aaron Jae (Evil Breaks)  breakbeat
Alxndr (Downlow)  breakbeat
DJ Bam (Evil Breaks)  breakbeat
Chris Jackson (Resource Records, Refined Music)  old school/acid breaks
Greg J (kidbippy.com, Funky Cactus) breakbeat hardcore
M.O.D vs. Thomas Kent (Evil Breaks, Modified) progressive breaks
Shazbot (FingerMonsters, Moksha Tribe, DEF) tech house/electro



SF warehouse location
Sound by DEF Audio and Evil Breaks
Lasers by Stim-U-Lights
Blacklight environments by Parallaxia
Free water & fruit
$8 presales available at groovetickets.com 
<http://www.groovetickets.com/ordersystem/Groove/eventviewqb.asp?AffilID=93&EventsID=20378&PGname=Evil+Breaks>
$9 presales available at Skills in Berkeley, Reverb in SF, & Solid 
Grooves in San Jose
$12 at the door



415.289.6886
def@defsf.com
www.evilbreaks.com


Stay tuned for more Forces of Nature events in 2006!

--0-1760532141-1135023568=:6922
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

I lurk here, but I'm chatty on the raverg list. I just find I have more in common over all with the self-identified 'older' ravers. 
   
  I do enjoy the music and scene information here, and I learn a great deal. But I also find the labels and endless subgenres limiting in terms of what people are 'allowed' to enjoy. It seems that if you admit to liking a particular sound or person, it sparks some pretty passionate naysaying that I don't think really encourages honest opinion sharing. So while I appreciate the suggestions on the music, I'm not enticed to go out on a limb and share my feedback, particularly as I find I'm often on the opposing side of show reviews here.
   
  How am I? Pretty damn good and looking forward to a 'grate' 2006. 
  Happy pagan holidays, KFH
   
  Karina <karina@hyperreal.org> wrote:
  Here's your opportunity to delurkify yourself before 2005 is over with! 
How many of you are lurking on this list and if so, how the heck are you 
and what have you been doing? :)

Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR: Use it.

Iy, chi hua hua..  I mean, the funny thing is that in a group like this, calling somebody, to paraphrase, "a faggot" is hardly worth doing.  Should I be insulted?  Should I laugh?  
 
 Shawn's a quality character that I make music with, and I'm sure I'd copulate wildly with him if we had different sexual preferences, but that's beside the point, really.  He is good people.  I have found some of the things you've said here to be offensive at worst and flamebait at best (and yes, I did RTFOP).  I know it's not terribly good netiquette to poke or prod flamers but I understand you're jesting, I'm jesting, none of this is real, so who cares, really?
 
 You seem to have taken on the mantle of demagogue, Shawn is a take-no-sh*tter online, and me, well, I like to laugh and point.  ..and find new ways to cook tofu.  We all have our roles.
 
 I've read my Anton Wilson, my Adams, my Malaclypse the Younger.  I know where your particular brand of tomfoolery springs from, and far-be-it-from-me to keep you from turning SFR into your own personal stream of conciousness.  Be my guest.  It's just that when you make scoffing threats at friends of mine, I get to scoff back, capice?  Share and share the waste of electrons alike.
 
 Lately this list has turned into a study of how to marginalize onesself, then flip the situation to make it appear that one is the victim.  Too funny.  I think I've hung out in Emi's back yard with you, Giles.  I think we might have talked about music or something.  You're more entertaining than insulting and you seem to be a smart cat.
 
 The internet is a tremendously effective way to garner attention for onesself, and I think you've found your forum!  All of this sturm-und-drang is just another layer of me-me-me-pick-me-*waves hand*-ism, and I suppose that's perfectly alright, and in keeping with your pattern.  
 
 Cock!  It's what's for dinner.
 
 Fnord,
 -GC

few archive tapes of the endless practice sessions of
those early morning hours in my dinky box garage
apartment thing... in those days, chris would rock out
3 tracks, i would trainwreck 3 tracks, he'd rock 3
more and i'd screw up 3 more... it went on for hours,
and silly me, i recorded it all. lol. I learned all I
could from him before actual playing out experience
took over.. and then he turned all techno on me..
bleh.
Oh well, good times Obi-Wan!

Subject: [sfraves] Regarding Lurking . . . .



I've been continuously on this list for over a decade . . .
granted I don't post that often, but I try to get a word in, edgewise
from time to time.

I will forever be grateful to this list for helping us launch Frequency 8
in 1995 - hard to believe that we did a $3. party, every 2 weeks,
on the beach, from May to October of that year.
Everyone who helped out, everyone who came - came because
of this list.  Some of those people became lifelong friends.

I feel that I know a lot of the people who post with current
regularity probably far better than you guys know me.
That may be changing, soon.

My admiration/respect/gratitude for what Brian, Terry and Katrina have
done to keep this venue vital is lifelong.

Namaste and I hope everyone has the best holidays, possible!

Jim Cyr
Frequency 8
Sweet !
Illuminaughty
